step1.sentence: Once you learn the shortcut keys, editing the spreadsheet is a piece of cake.

step2.story: Maya had been nervous about the driving test for weeks. When it was over and she had passed, she laughed and said it was a piece of cake — mostly to reassure her younger sister who was next in line.

step3.story: Owen had never baked anything more complex than boxed brownies. When his flatmate dared him to make a layered birthday cake from scratch, he almost said no. But after watching a few tutorial videos, he realized the steps were simpler than they looked. By Saturday evening, a lopsided but genuinely delicious chocolate layer cake sat on the kitchen counter. It was, he admitted to himself, not exactly a piece of cake — but close enough that he was already planning to bake again.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 일이 매우 쉽거나 별 노력 없이 해낼 수 있을 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 1930년대 미국에서 쉽고 즐거운 것을 비유하는 표현으로 정착했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 자신감이나 약간의 자랑 뉘앙스가 담길 수 있으며, 다른 사람을 안심시킬 때도 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Installing the app is a piece of cake.
